    Filter data function

    filter_data.Rd

    This function calculates metrics based on a given algorithm (e.g. mean, range, etc.) on the used dataset (e.g. fire_train) filters the data by a given column name and a value and by a column range

    filter_data(data, col_to_filter_by, subset, start_col, end_col, alg)

    Arguments

    data

    Data to be filtered

    col_to_filter_by

    Name of the column which should be used for filtering the data.

    subset

    The filtering condition which the targeted function should follow.

    start_col

    The start of the column range which should be selected from the data.

    end_col

    The end of the column range which should be selected from the data.

    alg

    The filtering algorithm which the targeted function should follow.

    Value

    Return the data filtered by the parameters above.

    Examples

    filter_data(
  data.frame(
    type = c("big", "big", "small"),
    length = c(5.2, 2.1, 1.2),
    height = c(10.1, 20.1, 4.2),
    depth = c(3, 2, 1.8)
  ), type, "big", height, depth, mean
)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   height depth
#>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1   15.1   2.5
